frameDefinitions: A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs.
Individuals first encounter each other and make introductions at a particular Time, Place, or Context.
Ambient conditions of temperature, precipitation, windiness, and sunniness pertain at a certain Place and Time.
An Entity is affected by an Event.

A Manner describes general or specific characteristics of an event in one of three ways:  First, it can refer to how a Comparison_event transpires, absent the influence of an entity (e.g. 'the way you talk').
frameExamples: That they got the same answers is just a <t>coincidence</t>.
Impressed when he first <t>met</t> Nixon, he had always thought of him as an intelligent man, and believed that Nixon would take a stand for civil rights
The hotel is <t>undergoing</t> renovations at this time.
He completed the task in a fervent <t>manner</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs.
The persons (or in rare cases animals) that make each other's acquaintance.
The semantically more prominent one of the two parties when the Individuals are realized separately.
The semantically less prominent of the two parties when the <fen>Individuals</fen> are expressed separately.
The time when the Individuals make each other's acquaintance.
The location where the Individuals make each others acquaintance.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the weather occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the weather occurs.
The thing which is affected by the Event.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the <fen>Event</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the <fen>Event</fen>.

The <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is the principal event being characteriszed by the <fen>Manner</fen>. The <fen>Manner</fen> of this <fen>Comparison_event</fen> is often used in comparison with the <fen>Foreground_event</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> that is associated with or directly responsible for the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen>.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> conducts or engages in the <fen>Comparison_activity</fen> that is being described.
listRoleExamples: Is it a coincidence <fex>that most of the planets fall within the Titius-Bode law's boundaries</fex>?
<fex>Last night's</fex> coincidences were too much for me to handle.
Several strange coincidences <fex>at the airport</fex> got the attention of federal officials.
<fex>My wife and I</fex> met in college working in the theatre and we will have been married for 30 years in June 2000.
<fex>Melissa Hurley</fex> had never met her neighbor, Richard Congdon ? the dog owner ? until recently, when she and a reporter knocked on his door.
Gossip reports say she either met <fex>Kennedy</fex> while helping him shop for suits at Calvin Klein, or was contacted by him after he saw her jogging in a New York park
I met my wife <fex>2 yrs ago</fex>.
Bill met his  wife <fex>in Poltava, Ukraine</fex>.
